ca.gkelly.engine.util

Class Vector

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.gkelly.engine.util.Vector

  • public class Vector
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to do vector math
    Supports rectangular, normalized and polar vectors

    • Field Summary

      To be passed to getString(), indicates that the output will be polar coordinates

              double magnitude,
              boolean ccw)
        Create the vector using a length and direction
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle away from up, in radians
        magnitude - The length of the vector
        ccw - Flag to indecate couter-clockwise angle

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(int mode)
        Get a string representation of vector
        Parameters:
        mode - The info to output
        - STRING_NORMALIZED Contains normalized X and Y
        - STRING_COMPONENT Contains full X and Y components
        - STRING_POLAR Contains angle from up and length

      • getAngle

        public double getAngle(Vector v,
                       boolean ccw)
        Get the angle to another vector, using dot and cross
        Parameters:
        v - The other vector
        ccw - Flag to indicate counter-clockwise
        Returns:
        Radian angle from this vector to v
